cluster_classes.class_description: Processes and channels that enable the spread and rapid transmission of information, particularly in the context of how stories or legends propagate through society.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Advancements in technology and communication platforms enable rapid transmission of information and proliferation of urban legends.

members.entity_description: Improvements in technological capabilities and tools that enable faster and broader dissemination of information, including urban legends.
Means of transmitting information, identified as enabling faster spread of urban legends.
The fast spread and sharing of information enabled by modern communication channels.
Various online and offline communication channels and media used to share stories and information, such as websites, apps, and broadcast media.

cluster_classes.class_description: Networked digital channels that enable rapid, wide dissemination of content to large audiences, such as the internet and social media platforms.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: In the age of the internet and social media, stories can be shared and disseminated at lightning speed.

members.entity_description: Global digital network described as a medium that accelerates sharing of stories and legends.
Online platforms that allow rapid, wide dissemination of urban legend stories.

cluster_classes.class_description: Processes involved in how stories are communicated and change over time, including oral sharing, passing between generations, and gradual adaptation.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: shared orally, passed down from one generation to the next, and evolved over time

members.entity_description: The practice of sharing tales verbally and passing them between generations.
Passing stories from one generation to the next within a culture.
The gradual change and adaptation of stories over time.

cluster_classes.class_description: Social and economic mechanisms that link societies and enable the spread of stories, ideas, and legends across regions.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: As societies became more interconnected through trade and travel, urban legends began to spread across regions and continents.

members.entity_description: Societies linked through trade and travel, facilitating the spread of legends.
Exchange of goods and services that contributes to cross-cultural contact.
Movement of people between places that helps spread stories and legends.

args.justification: The entity 'communication platforms and media' is a concrete digital/mediated channel (websites, apps, broadcast media) and aligns more closely with 'Digital Communication Media' than with the more abstract, process-focused 'Information Dissemination Mechanisms' class.

args.new_description: Abstract socio-technical processes that enable the spread and rapid transmission of information, including improvements in technology and communication methods.
args.justification: Renaming clarifies that this class covers abstract processes (e.g., advancements in technology, communication, rapid transmission) rather than specific media channels, and the new Class_Group standardizes the shared domain across related classes.

args.new_description: Digital and networked channels such as the internet and social media platforms that enable rapid, wide dissemination of stories and other content to large audiences.
args.justification: Updating the name and description emphasizes the focus on concrete media channels (internet, social media, apps, broadcast media) and aligns its Class_Group with other dissemination-related classes for a coherent upper-level schema.

args.new_description: Cultural processes by which stories are communicated, passed between generations, and gradually adapted over time, including oral storytelling and intergenerational transmission.
args.justification: Refining the name and description clarifies that this class covers cultural processes of story transmission and evolution, and assigning the shared Class_Group connects it to other dissemination mechanisms without merging distinct concepts.

args.new_description: Social and economic mechanisms—such as trade, travel, and interconnected societies—that link regions and enable the cross-cultural spread of stories, ideas, and legends.
args.justification: Updating the name and description makes the mechanism focus explicit and assigning the same Class_Group unifies this with other classes that describe how stories and information spread across people, media, and cultures.

executed_decisions.justification: The entity 'communication platforms and media' is a concrete digital/mediated channel (websites, apps, broadcast media) and aligns more closely with 'Digital Communication Media' than with the more abstract, process-focused 'Information Dissemination Mechanisms' class.
